page.title: 10THE MANOR HOUSE
page.content: The Manor House by Durleigh Resevoir goes right back to the year 600. After the Norman Conquest William the Conqueror awarded the house to a mercenary named Alfredo de Hispania. List of previous owners. 1066....Saric (last saxon owner) 1086....Welter de Dowai 1233....William Briwere the younger 1234....Margaret de le Ferte (sister of William Briwere) 1335....Hugh Meselyn 1336....Richard de Cocker 1420....Mathew Cocker 1460....Margaret (daughter of John cocker) and wife of Alexander Hody (died 1461) and Sir Reginald Stourton 1490....John Seymour (cousin of Margaret Stourton) 1491....John Seymour (son) 1536....Sir Edward Seymour,lord protector,Duke of Somerset.
